title: Ticket #149: Get gittrac off port 9090 and on more appropriate DNS name
description: Summary says it all, if this site is going to go public it should be on port 80 and probably on something like fw.cs.wisc.edu instead of pinguino.cs.wisc.edu
remarks:
2009-Jan-30 11:24:47 by tannenba:
Ok, my plan to accomplish this is to create a virtual host name and run gittrac via cgi under the apache web server on pinguino. It will be easy since the CSL is all equipped for this. Note this will also get us access via https (maybe https access should be the default?).

So, any thoughts on hostnames? Brainstorm ideas: 

  fw.cs.wisc.edu
  condor-gittrac.cs.wisc.edu
  condor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu

Others?

2009-Jan-30 16:11:55 by matt:
Having flightworthy or condor in the name is probably best, though fw.cs is easy to type

2009-Feb-02 11:46:44 by psilord:
I recommend names like:

  • condor-fw.cs.wisc.edu
  • condor-devel.cs.wisc.edu

I don't recommend names like:

  • condor-stomps-on-kittens.cs.wisc.edu
  • ford-mustang.cs.wisc.edu

2009-Feb-04 16:21:04 by tannenba:
Ok, requested the CSL to create a virtual host name of condor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu. CSL ticket number 367121.

2009-Feb-04 19:22:39 by matt:
Is the name people see going to be wiki.condorproject.org still? Or is that just going to be a thin redirect?

2009-Feb-10 15:01:35 by tannenba:
Ok, site is now at condor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu (a virtual name which leads to an Apache instance running on pinguino.cs). DNS name wiki.condorproject.org will redirect to the above. For a few days/weeks, pinguino:9090 will also redirect to the above.
creator: matt
